p: A total of 100 g of powder of different parts (roots, seeds, leaves, and capitula) of A. pyrethrum was extracted by maceration with 1000 mL of 70% ethanol at room temperature for 48 h. The mixtures were filtered and evaporated at 40 °C, and the residue obtained was then kept at 4 °C until further use. The extraction yield for roots and seeds was 16% and 10%, respectively, and a value of 14% was noted for both leaves and capitula extracts.
